title: ParDoTest cases that should be ValidatesRunner
body:
Discovered that these ParDoTest cases were not running because they were annotated only as NeedsRunner. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: TestStream tests should be ValidatesRunner
body:
I noticed that these are only marked NeedsRunner, so they will be missed when checking implementations by various runners. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11648] Resubmit Storage API sink with broken test removed.
body: The test was broken and didn't test anything. A better test would be to modify BigQueryTornadoes to test this path, but we will do this in a different PR (first we need to ensure that the testing project is whitelisted by BigQuery).

title: [BEAM-12024] Move examples.wordcount_dataframe to examples.dataframe, add taxiride example
body:
This PR creates a new `examples.dataframe` module and moves `wordcount_dataframe` into it. It also creates two new example pipelines in `examples.dataframe.taxiride`, one based on the aggregation pipeline from https://beam.apache.org/blog/dataframe-api-preview-available/, and one that augments that pipeline with a join on the taxi zone lookup table. title: Add ULR, Dataflow V2 and Java11 Jenkins statuses to PR template
body:
These tests went red and seemingly went unnoticed. The format of the PR template is showing its limits. I switched to HTML because editing the huge lines was very difficult. Probably could use a refactor and probably should be autogenerated. For now, just adding the additional statuses. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Increase Dataflow streaming ValidatesRunner timeout
body:
The last stable build was 257 minutes of the 270 minute timeout. We should get further away from the likelihood of timeouts. (this is independent of working to reduce the duration) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11886] Sickbay unsupported MapState, SetState, committed metrics for Dataflow streaming
body:
Two independent commits easy to review together: - sickbay new MapState and SetState (recently added but not healthy for Dataflow streaming) - exclude committed metrics, which have never been supported These are both failing https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow_Streaming ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: More extensive side input reiteration and pagination tests.
body:
This tests accessing an iterable side input multiple times, in parallel, and at different pages (if small pagination is enabled). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-12021] Add Pubsub overrides before portable proto translation in Dataflow
body:
These overrides were implicitly removed when we switched to using the original graph instead of the override graph. But Dataflow still needs these overrides. title: [BEAM-11227] Moving from vendored gRPC 1.26 to 1.36
body:
The vendored gRPC artifact is available in Maven Central: https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.apache.beam/beam-vendor-grpc-1_36_0/0.1/jar . This PR uses the artifact and deletes the reference to the old gRPC 1.26. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11862] Updates ExternalTransformFinder to consider external leaf transforms
body:
This fixes a bug where some pipelines with external transforms would not correctly be identified as multi-language pipelines. Dataflow needs to correctly identify multi-language pipelines to enable portable job submission (which is required to execute such pipelines). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-7372] remove codepath and workaround for py2 from io

title: [BEAM-12023] Use SamzaPipelineRunner instead of SamzaJobInvocation to run portable pipelines
body:
As part of 1.5 samza upgrade, some of the old classes from the internal fork undid the changes introduce as part of [BEAM-6725]. As a result, the upgrades done as part of [BEAM-5600], [BEAM-2939] are rendered useless. Update `SamzaJobServerDriver` to use `SamzaPipelineRunner` and clean up `SamzaJobInvocation` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-12022] Touch up Go ValidatesRunner docs and remove old gradle tasks
body:
Touch up Go ValidatesRunner docs and remove old gradle tasks. What it says on the tin. This adjusts the comments slightly and removes some of the old, now unused, gradle tasks and the old script. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9615] Misc final schema cleanups.
body:
* Allow arbitrary number of fields for row headers. Turns out sometimes a struct can have more than 256 fields. * Error, not panic for unknown kinds when Row coding. * Handle time.Time for schema encoding. Not treated as a logical type. * Register Schema initialization. * Add schema registration to code generator. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-12020] Combine license copy tasks for Java docker images
body:
Changes to maybe fix flaky errors in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-12020 about folder not being present if this doesn't fix it, potentially an issue with the dependency-license-report plugin that was recently bumped up in version R: @tysonjh R: @alanmyrvold Tested with/without `-Pdocker-pull-licenses` and with/without changes - new image differes slightly in that the old image actually has two copies of the golang licenses due to the behavior of COPY line in old Dockerfile i.e. before changes ``` $ ls /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/golang github.com golang.org google.golang.org licenses list.csv $ ls /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/golang/licenses github.com golang.org google.golang.org list.csv ``` and after is: ``` $ ls /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/golang licenses $ ls /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/golang/licenses github.com golang.org google.golang.org list.csv ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-7093] Update some out-of-date Gradle Spark instructions.
body:
R: @iemejia ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-12021] Remove portability overrides from runner v1 overrides in DataflowRunner
body:
The eliminates the branching logic in the runner v1 overrides. It puts the runner v2 overrides into a separate method and applies them before producing the proto for portable job submission. This does _not_ get us all the way to a dual v1/v2 submission. Remaining uses of `useUnifiedWorker`: - activating portable overrides - skipping v1beta3 translation when the overrides will make translation fail - worker harness container image (needs to be independent codepaths) - deciding whether to stage worker jar - setting environment version ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11023] Fix GroupByKeyTest testLargeKeys100MB and testGroupByKeyWithBadEqualsHashCode failing on Spark Structured Streaming runner
body:
**Test**: testLargeKeys100MB **Problem**: Out of Memory when running test **Solution**: Increase max memory in spark_runner.gradle **Test**: testGroupByKeyWithBadEqualsHashCode **Problem**: IllegalAccessError on inner classes BadEqualityKey and DeterministicKeyCoder **Solution**: Add access level modifier "protected" to classes. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-621] Add MapKeys, MapValues transforms
body:
* Added `MapKeys` and `MapValues` `PTransform`s that cover the next cases: * `PCollection => PCollection` * `PCollection => PCollection` * Added `MapToKeys` and `MapToValues` `PTransform`s that cover the next cases: * `PCollection => PCollection` * `PCollection => PCollection` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-3415] Amend TestPipeline to work with JUnit5
body:
This makes `TestPipeline` implement a JUnit5 extension, making it usable with the JUnit5 extensions mechanism (what used to be "Rules" in JUnit4). It's semantically the same code, the only outward noticeable change would be JUnit5 uses `@Tag` instead of `@Category`, and they're string values not classes, so `@Category(NeedsRunner.class)` becomes `@Tag("needsRunner")` -- open to guidance on the value here, happy to consider the existing one a placeholder. This also adds a separate JUnit5 test for the capablities of `TestPipeline` and a JUnit5 run in the `build.gradle`. It should be fine running side-by-side (both in theory and at least my experience) since they use different annotations etc., JUnit5 will only pick up the Jupiter annotations and JUnit4 will only use the `org.junit` ones. R: @lukecwik ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-12011] Eliminate WindowFn.getOutputTime method
body:
See [dev@ thread](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r99d0efa70f83815e17a1dbfb94effd16b38176046ac8ffbfe371c895%40%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E) where consensus is that the existence of this method is a _bug_ and it should be eliminated. See next [user@ thread](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7220ad2732e3d93e23e1f8af8051c5f6f6d72efdf556a467b9afb9fc%40%3Cuser.beam.apache.org%3E) where no one responded. Perhaps because it is complex and esoteric. Important points to consider about this change, worth repeating in the PR: - the method is annotated "experimental" but it has been around since the very early days of Beam so we should ignore that - it was added as response to a _real user problem_: sliding windows + `EARLIEST` timestamp combiner delays downstream aggregations a lot - but when that problem occurred, timestamp combiner `EARLIEST` was the default; with the change to how lateness is defined we changed the default to `END_OF_WINDOW` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-12010] Create separate merge rules for different Calc implement…
body:
…ations. Once we implement Calc splitting, CalcMergeRule will attempt to merge Calcs back together, which defeats the purpose of splitting them in the first place. We will need to narrow the merge conditions, to prevent incompatible Calcs from being merged. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8376] Google Cloud Firestore Connector - Add Firestore V1 Write Operations
body:
First PR in a series of PRs to add sources and sinks for Google Cloud Firestore. This PR adds a sink for writing Documents to Cloud Firestore. This PR also includes common code that is shared between the sources and Firestore SDK adapter which will be added in follow up PRs. (If desired I can split the common code into a separate PR, but I thought it wouldn't make much sense without the context of it being used). Each commit has a detailed commit message, however a brief summary of the 4 commits included in this PR are as follows: ### Gradle Add Google Cloud Firestore dependencies. Version 2.2.4+ is needed for all dependencies which include bugfixes and the necessary grpc client, protos and bootstraping code. ### Common Classes A set of base classes which underpin the added PTransforms and DoFns that will make up the connector. This change also includes the base classes used in the unit and integration test suites which are present for each component of the connector. ### RPC QoS Classes All read and write RPC Operations are managed in coordination with the RPC QoS layer. Attempt counts, backoff amounts, batch sizing, success, failure metrics, throttling are all managed here. ### Firestore v1 Write Operations Add PTransforms for writing to Cloud Firestore via the BatchWrite API. There are two implementations which only differ in what happens when an error is encountered. The first implementation will throw an exception if an error is encountered, whereas the second implementation will output a failure object (functioning similar to a dead letter queue). ## Integration Tests The integration test suite will only run if `GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS` or `FIRESTORE_EMULATOR_HOST` are present in the environment. The project the tests run against must have a [Firestore in Native mode](https://cloud.google.com/datastore/docs/firestore-or-datastore#in_native_mode) database configured (Firestore in Native Mode and Firestore in Datastore Mode cannot both be present in the same project at this time). All integration tests are self contained and do not depend on preconfigured external state, and clean up after themselves. A future PR will be created for sources, and another PR for a Firestore SDK adapter which both will leverage the common code added in this PR. ## Reviewers R: @chamikaramj R: @jlara310 (Firestore Technical Writer) R: @clement (Firestore Dataplane TL) R: @danthev (Firestore SRE) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11227] Fixed class relocation for vendored gRPC 1.36.0 module
body:
Followup of https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/14242. title: [BEAM-10402] Fix nullability issues with BeamZetaSqlCalcRel
body:
Remove a misimplemented optimization that leads to failed null checks in BeamZetaSqlCalcRel Also fix nullability of this class in general. Error seen during run: ``` Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Null future org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.zetasql.AutoValue_BeamZetaSqlCalcRel_TimestampedFuture.(AutoValue_BeamZetaSqlCalcRel_TimestampedFuture.java:23) org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.zetasql.BeamZetaSqlCalcRel$TimestampedFuture.create(BeamZetaSqlCalcRel.java:104) org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.zetasql.BeamZetaSqlCalcRel$TimestampedFuture.access$500(BeamZetaSqlCalcRel.java:102) org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.zetasql.BeamZetaSqlCalcRel$CalcFn.processElement(BeamZetaSqlCalcRel.java:254) ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9185] Publish pre-release python artifacts (RCs) to PyPI

Update steps 4 and 7 Step 4: Added the rc variable in both (automatic and manual) steps and Attention notes. Step 7: Added a final step - Upload release candidate to PyPI. title: Minor FhirIO Search changes
body:
- Correct comment for how to form "OR" vs "AND" searches. - Add toString method to FhirSearchParameter, to make diffs easier to read. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11907] SQS source with full functionality
body:
The current SqsIO source connector has limited functionality. This PR implements the following functionalities to SqsIO: - Batch message deletion (mitigate throttled deleteMessage requests) - Extension of visibility timeout (The existing implementation causes message duplication) - Update watermarks when no new messages are pulled New functionalities are written with reference to the pubsub connector. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11227] Preparing vendored gRPC 1.36.0
body:
This PR prepared the vendored gRPC 1.36.0 release. This PR does not use the artifact yet. PR where I tested the vendored gRPC: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/14028 Command to confirm this branch generates the JAR file: ``` suztomo-macbookpro44% ./gradlew :vendor:grpc-1_36_0:shadowJar Configuration on demand is an incubating feature. Deprecated Gradle features were used in this build, making it incompatible with Gradle 7.0. Use '--warning-mode all' to show the individual deprecation warnings. See https://docs.gradle.org/6.8/userguide/command_line_interface.html#sec:command_line_warnings BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 1s 1 actionable task: 1 from cache suztomo-macbookpro44% jar tvf vendor/grpc-1_36_0/build/libs/beam-vendor-grpc-1_36_0-0.1.jar | grep '\.so$' 2628280 Fri Aug 21 11:19:38 EDT 2020 META-INF/native/liborg_apache_beam_vendor_grpc_v1p36p0_netty_tcnative_linux_x86_64.so 1933284 Fri Aug 21 11:19:38 EDT 2020 META-INF/native/liborg_apache_beam_vendor_grpc_v1p36p0_netty_tcnative_linux_aarch64.so suztomo-macbookpro44% jar tf vendor/grpc-1_36_0/build/libs/beam-vendor-grpc-1_36_0-0.1.jar |grep io/grpc/Context.class org/apache/beam/vendor/grpc/v1p36p0/io/grpc/Context.class suztomo-macbookpro44% jar tf vendor/grpc-1_36_0/build/libs/beam-vendor-grpc-1_36_0-0.1.jar |grep netty/NettyClientHandler.class org/apache/beam/vendor/grpc/v1p36p0/io/grpc/netty/NettyClientHandler.class suztomo-macbookpro44% ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Update script and instructions for cutting release branch
body:
Updating cutting of release branch according to https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/205472bdaf3c2c5876533750d417c19b0d1078131a3dc04916082ce8%40%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E - Keep dev/SNAPSHOT version on release branch in script - Use `set_version.sh` to set the version, so the knowledge of all the places is in one script. - Add a diagram to illustrate the spec independent of the implementation. - Removing the manual steps which were just copied out of the script anyhow. - Updating the script instructions. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] Add NDFrame to doctests, implement a few more operations
body:
This PR adds a new test to run all NDFrame doctests. Several examples for shared Series/DataFrame functionality are only implemented in NDFrame, and don't get picked up in our tests that run Series/DataFrame tests individually. In addition the PR implements a few simple operatiosn that are tested on NDFrame: - `first`, `last`, `head`, `tail` are all now `WontImplement(order-sensitive)` on both DataFrame and Series - Adds an implementation for `tz_localize`. - Adds implementations for `bool()`, `size`, `empty`, `equals()` (all of these do some pre-aggregation followed by a final Singleton aggregation). - Adds implementation for `ndim` that defers to the proxy. title: [BEAM-11733] Adding LRO counters to FhirIO and re-enable FhirIO tests
body:
Adding counters for the success/failure counters that are output in the operation metadata after an LRO completes. We increment the counters after the operation is complete since we already wait on them. Tested that this change works properly for Import but I don't have tests for the other LROs. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Remove at most one line of whitespace after Out[]: prompt
body:
This modifies the regex used to remove whitespace after the Out[] prompt. The current version will continue trimming whitespace from the next line, this modifies it to stop after one line. title: Removes non-interactive from SVN commands
body:
With 'non-interactive', svn commands fail without prompting for credentials, if credentials are not found in the environment. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Few small updates to the release guide
body:
Fixing several issues I noticed while performing the 2.28.0 release. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Eliminate use_runner_v2, and use_unified_worker in the Java SDK, since beam_fn_api suffices
body:
I was not sure about KafkaIO. I believe this is safe for other runners since I already tested making the portable side input expansion the default and it only affects Dataflow. The idea is that we limit the number of experiments to just one, and we don't really care which one, and then we move off of them. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8787] Improve the contribution guide.
body:
`./gradlew check` consistently fails for me and the failures are consistently spurious. I don't think we run it in our CI at all, so it's liable to be broken at any time. In summary, the ./gradlew check is useless at best, misleading at worst. R: @tysonjh ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11613] Limits Dataflow GCR container image overriding
body:
Limits Dataflow GCR container image overriding to external Apache Beam container images We want to prevent following cases. * Overriding the container image set by pipeline SDK (which might be overridden for test environments). * Overriding non-Apache Beam containers set by external transforms. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10943] Add builtin functions in the Calcite planner.
body:
This prevents the builtin functions, which aren't used in ZetaSQL, from being added to the schema when using the ZetaSQL planner. Once we load schema-registered functions into ZetaSQL, some of the Calcite builtins would conflict with ZetaSQL builtins, which are loaded separately. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11797] Fixed the flaky test
body:
1. Fixed the flaky test by explicitly assert_called_with rendered HTML/Javascript strings. 2. The flakiness could be introduced from other display calls emitted from the IPythonLogHandler though couldn't reproduce it locally. To rule out the flakiness and since assertion at a lower level is added, assertion around display is discarded. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11968] Bump com.google.cloud:libraries-bom to 19.0.0
body:
Missing the isMtls() in google-http-client. Looks like it has been added since 1.38.0: https://github.com/googleapis/google-http-java-client/blob/master/google-http-client/src/main/java/com/google/api/client/http/HttpTransport.java#L136 Original stacktrace: ``` java.lang.RuntimeException: Encountered checked exception when constructing an instance from factory method DataflowRunner#fromOptions(interface org.apache.beam.sdk.options.PipelineOptions) at org.apache.beam.sdk.util.InstanceBuilder.buildFromMethod (InstanceBuilder.java:233) at org.apache.beam.sdk.util.InstanceBuilder.build (InstanceBuilder.java:158) at org.apache.beam.sdk.PipelineRunner.fromOptions (PipelineRunner.java:55) at org.apache.beam.sdk.Pipeline.create (Pipeline.java:154) ... at jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0 (Native Method) at jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64) at jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:564) at org.codehaus.mojo.exec.ExecJavaMojo$1.run (ExecJavaMojo.java:282) at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:832) Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: 'boolean com.google.api.client.http.HttpTransport.isMtls()' at com.google.api.services.storage.Storage$Builder.chooseEndpoint (Storage.java:11151) at com.google.api.services.storage.Storage$Builder. (Storage.java:11184) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.util.Transport.newStorageClient (Transport.java:97) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.util.GcsUtil$GcsUtilFactory.create (GcsUtil.java:104) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.util.GcsUtil$GcsUtilFactory.create (GcsUtil.java:93) at org.apache.beam.sdk.options.ProxyInvocationHandler.returnDefaultHelper (ProxyInvocationHandler.java:605) at org.apache.beam.sdk.options.ProxyInvocationHandler.getDefault (ProxyInvocationHandler.java:546) at org.apache.beam.sdk.options.ProxyInvocationHandler.invoke (ProxyInvocationHandler.java:171) at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy41.getGcsUtil (Unknown Source) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.storage.GcsPathValidator.verifyPathIsAccessible (GcsPathValidator.java:83) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.storage.GcsPathValidator.validateOutputFilePrefixSupported (GcsPathValidator.java:53) at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.DataflowRunner.fromOptions (DataflowRunner.java:291) at jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0 (Native Method) at jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64) at jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:564) at org.apache.beam.sdk.util.InstanceBuilder.buildFromMethod (InstanceBuilder.java:217) at org.apache.beam.sdk.util.InstanceBuilder.build (InstanceBuilder.java:158) at org.apache.beam.sdk.PipelineRunner.fromOptions (PipelineRunner.java:55) at org.apache.beam.sdk.Pipeline.create (Pipeline.java:154) ... at jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0 (Native Method) at jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64) at jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:564) at org.codehaus.mojo.exec.ExecJavaMojo$1.run (ExecJavaMojo.java:282) at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:832) ``` **Please** add a meaningful
